required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Angiographic Comparison in an Observational Study of CADence (The AMBIENCE Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Angiographic Comparison in an Observational Study of CADence (The AMBIENCE Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, multi-center study to capture information on sensitivity and specificity of CADence using coronary angiogram as the gold standard, on subjects who are already scheduled for coronary angiography.

detailed_description.textblock: CADence is an ECG and acoustic tool to assess coronary artery disease. This study's goal is to collect patient CADence information and compare it to the results of angiogram to determine performance: sensitivity and specificity. The CADence is not used to direct patient care. This is observational only.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With Positive Agreement of CADence Device Under Normal Use Conditions as Compared to Coronary Angiograms as Accurate and Appropriate
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours or discharge from hospital, whichever is sooner
primary_outcome.description: Angiographically significant stenosis was defined as 70% or greater stenosis in any major coronary artery. Percent of Participants with Positive Agreement of CADence Device Under Normal Use Conditions as Compared to Coronary Angiograms as accurate and appropriate. The study is used to determine two conditions. CADence = Positive for 70% or greater stenosis and CADence = Negative for less than 70% stenosis. The pre-specified intent of this Outcome Measure was to assess all study participants combined, irrespective of whether or not they participated in the Ambience main study or the repeatability and reproducibility sub-study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With CADence-related Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours or discharge from hospital, whichever is sooner

arm_group.description: CADence System testing followed by coronary angiogram
CADence System testing for repeatibility and reproducibility (4x by 2 operators) followed by coronary angiogram

study_pop.textblock: Subjects already scheduled for coronary angiography who meet study inclusion and exclusion criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >40 years
- Clinical indication for coronary angiogram
- Willing and able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Body Mass Index (BMI) <18.5 or >40
- Prior bypass surgery or coronary stenting
- Presence of pacemaker/defibrillator
- Presence of artificial valve
- Presence of obvious cyanotic or pre-diagnosed congenital heart defect and coarctation of the aorta
- Presence of murmurs, including valve lesions, ventricular septal defects and arteriovenous fistulae
- Presence of moderate-severe valve disease
- Left Ventricular Assist Device (LVAD)
- Presence of scars on the site thorax areas
- Participation in trial within 30 days prior to collecting CADence data except participation in registry studies.
- Asthma or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) with active wheezing
- Inability to lie in supine position
- Heart Transplant

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects >40 years of age and scheduled for clinically-indicated angiography were recruited at 3 hospitals across the US.

group.title: AMBIENCE Study
group.description: Participants in the initial AMBIENCE study period

group.title: AMBIENCE Plus R & R
group.description: Participants in the AMBIENCE plus Repeatability and Reproducibility portion of the study

group.title: AMBIENCE
group.description: CADence System testing followed by coronary angiogram CADence System: Obtain CADence data under normal conditions of use for comparison of results with those of coronary angiogram

group.title: AMBIENCE Plus R&R Substudy
group.description: CADence System testing for repeatability and reproducibility (4x by 2 operators) followed by coronary angiogram CADence System: Obtain CADence data under normal conditions for comparison of results with those of coronary angiogram. This part of the study includes patients who are a part of the AMBIENCE study.

outcome.title: Percent of Participants With Positive Agreement of CADence Device Under Normal Use Conditions as Compared to Coronary Angiograms as Accurate and Appropriate
outcome.description: Angiographically significant stenosis was defined as 70% or greater stenosis in any major coronary artery. Percent of Participants with Positive Agreement of CADence Device Under Normal Use Conditions as Compared to Coronary Angiograms as accurate and appropriate. The study is used to determine two conditions. CADence = Positive for 70% or greater stenosis and CADence = Negative for less than 70% stenosis. The pre-specified intent of this Outcome Measure was to assess all study participants combined, irrespective of whether or not they participated in the Ambience main study or the repeatability and reproducibility sub-study.
outcome.time_frame: 24 hours or discharge from hospital, whichever is sooner
outcome.population: The Ambience study included a sub-study within the same population. The sub-study was to evaluate the repeatability and reproducibility of the CADence System. Repeatability refers to the ability of the same System operator to obtain the same results each time the same subject is tested with the same System at two points in time. Reproducibility refers to the ability of different operators to obtain the same results when they evaluate the same subjects with either the same or different Systems.

group.title: Patient CADence Result
group.description: CADence System testing followed by coronary angiogram CADence System: Obtain CADence data under normal conditions of use for comparison of results with those of coronary angiogram

group.title: Repeatability and Reproducibility
group.description: The purpose of the study is to collect performance information regarding the use of the CADence system under normal conditions of use. Includes a 31-subject sub-study to assess the repeatability and reproducibility of the CADence system

measure.title: Percent of Participants With Positive Agreement of CADence Device Under Normal Use Conditions as Compared to Coronary Angiograms as Accurate and Appropriate
measure.description: Angiographically significant stenosis was defined as 70% or greater stenosis in any major coronary artery. Percent of Participants with Positive Agreement of CADence Device Under Normal Use Conditions as Compared to Coronary Angiograms as accurate and appropriate. The study is used to determine two conditions. CADence = Positive for 70% or greater stenosis and CADence = Negative for less than 70% stenosis. The pre-specified intent of this Outcome Measure was to assess all study participants combined, irrespective of whether or not they participated in the Ambience main study or the repeatability and reproducibility sub-study.
measure.population: The Ambience study included a sub-study within the same population. The sub-study was to evaluate the repeatability and reproducibility of the CADence System. Repeatability refers to the ability of the same System operator to obtain the same results each time the same subject is tested with the same System at two points in time. Reproducibility refers to the ability of different operators to obtain the same results when they evaluate the same subjects with either the same or different Systems.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With CADence-related Adverse Events
outcome.time_frame: 24 hours or discharge from hospital, whichever is sooner
outcome.population: All participants were assessed and none had adverse events

group.title: Adverse Events
group.description: There were zero reported adverse events.

measure.title: Number of Participants With CADence-related Adverse Events
measure.population: All participants were assessed and none had adverse events

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event information was only collected through study exit for each subject (1 day).
reported_events.desc: All Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) associated with CADence use through discharge were recorded. Those associated with the coronary angiogram and/or subsequent interventions were not collected.

group.title: AMBIENCE
group.description: CADence System testing followed by coronary angiogram CADence System: Obtain CADence data under normal conditions of use for comparison of results with those of coronary angiogram

group.title: AMBIENCE Plus R&R Substudy
group.description: CADence System testing for repeatibility and reproducibility (4x by 2 operators) followed by coronary angiogram CADence System: Obtain CADence data under normal conditions of use for comparison of results with those of coronary angiogram

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
